intro: Calophaca ferganensis, commonly known as the Fergana calophaca, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, aiding in water retention. Calophaca ferganensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
